name: Gondwana Game Reserve

reviews.text: The three days that we spent at Gondwana were magical. The quality of the accommodation and food, the professionalism and friendliness of the staff, the beauty of the location and last but not least the marvellous animals all enhanced the fantastic experience. We stayed in a three bedroomed, self catering villa but booked full board which included two game drives and breakfast, lunch, high tea and dinner. The food compared to the best we have eaten anywhere. Not many guests went on the early morning game drives but we had saw some fantastic sights in the morning often when we were the only guests there. The guides are incredibly knowledgable and made you feel very safe even when you are sitting twenty metres away from a pride of lions in an open land rover!
reviews.title: A magical experience

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, our experience at Gondwana was superb.
reviews.title: Simply stunning

reviews.text: All the staff we met along the way were warm, friendly and very helpful. Our accommodation was fantastic - we had a self catering house which was beautifully decorated and with stunning views.
reviews.title: magical family break

reviews.text: Breakfast was a feast, as was the high tea we experienced before our game drive. Forget (his name not my memory!) took us on the game drive and he was very informative, funny and charming and we were lucky to have seen the big 5 - a memory I will have forever. Considering we went in August and were expecting colder weather the heatwave we experienced only made the holiday more perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent experience for all travevellers

reviews.text: Gondwana is without a doubt a place we will return to - the kids are already trying to make a date!
reviews.title: We loved Gondwana!

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of spending a week at Gondwana and it was my best vacation yet. Accomodation facilities, friendly and efficient staff, food to die for and breakfast pastries which are absolutely sinful...one couldnt be spoilt more by total strangers.
reviews.title: Blissful April

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I experienced the wildlife up close in fact the very next morning, an Eland honoured me with his prescence a few hundred feet from my deck...it was beyond awesome
reviews.title: If you want to see big 5 ---forget it here

reviews.text: I saw the most amazing sunsets and sunrises and the views matched the wonderful friendly demeanour of all the staff
reviews.title: Luxury all the way

reviews.text: Thanks for a wonderful holiday
reviews.title: Peaceful Weekend

reviews.text: We love South Africa...we spent time at a game reserve in the Kruger a couple of years ago and it was one of he best experiences of our lives. This year we came in February to Cape Town to enjoy sun, wine, sightseeing and a safari. After research we settled on Gondwana which is a long drive from Cape town but we wanted to ensure we saw the best animals in the best environment...something Gondwana promised in its adverts. Firstly make sure you have a sturdy car.. The dirt track road goes on for about 15 miles and is a nightmare...It was a miracle we didn't get puncture... First impressions were actually good once we reached the camp. We were greeted by well mannered young rangers who carried our luggage and made us welcome.. The round Native style thatched huts were lovely and unusual. So after a nice lunch we were introduced to our ranger who was fairly new there. The game drive was a total waste of time.. The ranger was an expert on birds and we stopped and examined and discussed everything that flew but we never saw the animals we were promised...Sure a few Zebra and Gazelles but no Giraffes, Lion, Cheetah. One solitary Elephant and the tiniest part of a submerged hippo was the result of several hours bumping around. I was shocked to hear that on this huge expanse of land they only had a couple of lions and then they "maybe" had a cheetah who had come into the reserve by itself. This cost us £500 for one night and the next morning safari was no better.. Can only advise readers to stay away and go to Kruger
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: we were at Gondwana for only two nights at yet we managed to view so much such as: Hippo, Lions, Monkeys, Rhino, Buffalo, Giraffe, Zebra, Elephant, Ranges of buck and Birds such as our national bird and flower, proteas and the blue crane. We went as a family and stayed in this big and cozy guest house which ad an magnificent view of the reserve an we were lucky enough to hear the lions roar in the evenings. Dinner was delivered at night and breakfast was a buffet. Lunch was done amazingly and was delicious. Although we did have some bad points such as our fridge had no drinks and our fire wasn't lit when we got home which they said they would do.... Overall Gondwana is a lovely quiet and happy place and i'd like to thank our guide, Delicious.
reviews.title: Big space, lots of game.

reviews.text: My family - which includes a 10 month old - spent 4 days at Gondwana in the company of friends at one of the Villas. It was a fantastic experience! Gondwana is an awesome spot and is a great mix of luxury and quality service on a true game reserve.
reviews.title: Great game reserve break for family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, particularly given our little guy being along with us. We had meals served at the restaurant and in the villa, which was not only accommodating but a great experience for the parents! We found the rangers / guides to be knowledgeable and enthusiastic about all aspects of the bush, which is always appreciated.
reviews.title: Luxury Safari

reviews.text: Highly recommended for a luxurious safari breakaway, particularly if you're in the Cape area.
reviews.title: Fantastic Big 5 Experience on the Garden Route

reviews.text: This was my first safari, and my husband and I stayed for two days. We saw giraffes, elephants, hippos, and a lion, not to mention scores of zebras, antelopes, impala and herons. The food was amazing, our guide was knowledgeable and kind, and we'd go back in a second. The spa was also great - I got a hot stone massage and it's one of the best massages I've ever gotten (and one of the best values, also). My husband got a facial that he loved.
reviews.title: Perfect breakaway destination for couples and teams

reviews.text: Gondwana is not a typical African bush experience because of its location in a fynbos area and its relative age. In that context it is an excellent destination. The accommodation is very comfortable (Kwena huts) and the staff are friendly and helpful. The food was outstanding when the head chef (JC) was in attendance and was otherwise acceptable but not brilliant. The location is very scenic. The park shows its young age in that it is not yet mature so the biodiversity is not the same as a mature reserve and most of the animals are by definition newly introduced. We saw excellent Lion with cubs and were privileged to see a cheetah run down a small Eland. I was a bit disappointed in the bird life and it will take a long time for the place to feel truly wild but it is certainly one of the best game farms within 4 hours of Cape Town. There is a story online of the female elephant who was relocated from Bloemfontein Zoo to Gondwana and its an interesting conservation story. Two of the elephants were originally circus elephants who were also reintroduced - they could have more easily taken surplus elephants from Kruger but this gives a different angle and is more interesting.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: We used the conference facilities for meetings and it worked very well. Its not really a location targeted at experienced African game viewers and game viewing was certainly not our main objective. I think its more for foreigners looking for a quick, convenient (and very comfortable) game experience on the garden route. Locals looking for a night or two with a difference on the way to Plett or wanting to take visitors to a game farm nearby to Cape Town won't be disappointed. Its not cheap but there is no good game reserve which is.
reviews.title: Great family destination, new perspective on fynbos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a wonderful weekend at Gondwana in April 2013. Our kids took part in the Junior Rangers experience, and had an absolute ball. Food, accommodation and guiding was first rate. We were very spoilt and saw a lot - eles (including the new calf), lots of antelope - eland, wildebeest, red hartebeest, springbok, zebra - and the male lion and two cubs. I'm not especially hung up on seeing the Big Five (I got more excited by the secretarybirds), so was very satisfied with the game viewing. Staff were wonderful - lovely, warm and professional service and attention to detail. And the fynbos is amazing - and to see big game against this backdrop is a revelation. Definitely worth a trip, especially if you've 'done' cape town and you're heading up the Garden Route.
reviews.title: Luxury and Animals Around at Gondwana

reviews.text: You can have here a really nice experience. We saw cheetahs, lions, rhynos, zebras, hypo, bucks, elephant, wildebeest.. and a few more.. We did a game at sunset and one at the sunrise.. was a bit cold.. but it worth it.. the room is actually some kind of Luxury tent.. with bathtube, fireplace and minibar with wine.. beer.. etc all inclusive.. and also, once you lay down your bed and look at the top you can see the sky trough a window at the roof.. The food is also amazing. At night you cant walk around by yourself because of the animals... they can be around.. at bight you can hear then talking to you.. ;)
reviews.title: Autumn Visit in May

reviews.text: 8 of us chose to hire a rental pool home on Gondwana for 2 nights in mid May - 17,18 th. We had a ball, 'tween the beautifull valleys, the abundant birdlike, sunsets/rises and of course the game drives with knowledgeable guides. Also, the central 'clubhouse' was very smart yet apropriate for the surroundings with views 'for Africa'.
reviews.title: Great game experience amongst the fynbos!

description: Gondwana Game Reserve provides the perfect safari break less than 4 hours drive from Cape Town and 45 minutes from George airport along South Africa’s popular Garden Route. The 11,000 hectare private game reserve offers a distinctive malaria-free safari experience in a spectacular mountain and Fynbos landscape adding vivid colour and interest to a Big Five wilderness experience. This exclusive reserve offers guests attentive service, superb cuisine, inspiring interiors, expert game rangers and a fun Junior Ranger Program for the kids. Kwena Lodge boasts 14 Khoi-San inspired Kwena Rooms. Each open plan suite is nestled into its spectacular surrounds with 180-degree views of the spectacular surrounds overlooking 2 waterholes where elephant frequent. The rooms offer sky lights for star gazing, clay pot fireplaces and deep baths to keep you warm upon return from an evening game drive. The spacious lodge facilities include a large infinity pool, chic open-plan lounge and bar, with food and beverage services offered in an elegant dining room set around 2 open fireplaces or in the outdoor boma.
